actions

Note

Many current actions invoke the notify* methods in task_executor.abstract_step.AbstractStep, such as task_executor.abstract_step.AbstractStep.notify_service_called(). For the purposes of this challenge, you can ignore making those calls.

Contents

  • actions

    • move

move

class task_executor.actions.move.MoveAction[source]

Bases: AbstractStep

Move to a location, or a series of locations in the map. Requires a localized robot

BELIEF_KEYS = ['ROBOT_AT_DROPOFF', 'ROBOT_AT_PICK_POINT', 'TASK_AT_DROPOFF']
MOVE_ACTION_SERVER = '/navigation'
SEMANTIC_LOCATIONS_SERVICE_NAME = '/database/semantic_locations'
WAYPOINTS_SERVICE_NAME = '/database/waypoints'
init(name)[source]

Initialize the step. Called when connections to ROS must be setup.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Name of the action or task. Used as an identifier

  • args – Additional args that might be relevant. Missing by default

  • kwargs – Additional args that could be relevant. Missing by default

run(location, update_belief=True)[source]

The run function for this step

Parameters:

location (str, list, tuple, dict) –

The location to move to. If the type is:

  • str. Then if the string starts with

    • locations, assume the rest of the string specifies the tf frame of the waypoint and therefore move to the pose [0, 0, 0] w.r.t that frame

    • waypoints, get a list of task_execution_msgs/Waypoint poses from WAYPOINTS_SERVICE_NAME; visit the waypoints in order

  • dict. Then if the keys of the dict are

    • x, y, theta, frame, visit the waypoint defined by the dict

  • list, tuple. Then if the list is of

    • dicts of the previous case, visit the waypoints in the list or tuple in order

See also

task_executor.abstract_step.AbstractStep.run()

stop()[source]

Stop the step. How this is handled by the client is up to the client.
